the mind faculty is common to the three realms, the nine grounds, and the five classes of contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas and types of knowledge,
therefore it is the object of the sixteen consciousnesses.
First, the consciousness associated with all latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm.
This consciousness is all that is to be eliminated by seeing suffering in the desire realm,
and the pervasive latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation [of suffering] increase along with it.
Second, the consciousness associated with all latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation [of suffering] in the desire realm.
This consciousness is all that is to be eliminated by seeing the accumulation [of suffering] in the desire realm,
and the pervasive latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing suffering increase along with it.
Third, the consciousness associated with the latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm that have conditioned objects.
This consciousness is that which has conditioned objects to be eliminated by seeing cessation in the desire realm,
and the pervasive latent tendencies increase along with it.
Fourth, the consciousness associated with all latent tendencies to be eliminated by seeing the path in the desire realm.
This consciousness is increased by all the permeating and particular passions abandoned in the path of insight in the realm of desire.
The good and defiled consciousnesses and the non-obscured non-defined consciousnesses of the realm of desire abandoned through the path of cultivation.
This consciousness is increased by all the passions abandoned through the path of cultivation in the realm of desire,
and by the permeating passions.
Just as the consciousnesses of the five classes of passions with a specific object in the realm of desire,
so also are the consciousnesses of the five classes of passions with a specific object in the realm of form and in the formless realm.
Together they make up the fifteen consciousnesses.
The sixteenth is the pure consciousness,
namely, the classes of the receptivities and knowledges of the truths of suffering, of the origin of suffering, and of the path, in the realm of desire.
This consciousness is not increased by the proclivities.

Therefore it is said that the consciousnesses that have a specific object consisting of the faculty of thought have a specific object consisting of the compounded and are increased by the proclivities.
The consciousnesses that have a specific object consisting of the faculty of thought as condition are the objects of the sixteen consciousnesses.
The proclivities that increase the consciousnesses that have a specific object consisting of the faculty of thought as condition
are also said to be the same as those that increase the consciousnesses that have a specific object consisting of the faculty of thought.

Therefore it is said that the consciousnesses that have a specific object consisting of the faculty of thought as condition have a specific object consisting of the compounded and are increased by the proclivities. The same is true of the faculty of indifference.

The faculty of renunciation also extends to the three realms, nine levels, five classes, contaminated and uncontaminated dharmas, and the categories of dharma and subsequent cognition, because it is like the faculty of intention.
The consciousness that takes the faculty of pleasure as its object is of four kinds in the desire realm.
In the form realm, it is conditioned; in the formless realm, it is of two kinds.
The consciousness that takes it as its object through association is of four kinds in the desire and formless realms.
In the form realm, it is conditioned.
The faculty of pleasure extends to the desire realm, the first, and the third meditative absorptions.
In the desire realm,
it is associated with the five consciousnesses.
In the first meditative absorption,
it is associated with three consciousnesses.
These two are only contaminated and are eliminated by cultivation.
In the third meditative absorption,
it is associated with mental consciousness and extends to both contaminated and uncontaminated states.
The contaminated states extend to the five classes.
The uncontaminated states extend to the categories of dharma and subsequent cognition.

and the pervasive latent afflictions abandoned by seeing the origin are also increased.

Because this consciousness is not increased by the latent afflictions.
